headline: GE Aerospace (GE) Declares Regular Quarterly Dividend
summary: GE Aerospace (NYSE:GE) is among the 12 Best Defense Stocks to Buy Right Now. On September 18, the company’s Board of Directors authorized a quarterly dividend of $0.36 per share on common stock. The dividend will be paid on October 27, 2025, to all shareholders on record as of September 29, 2025, which will also […]

headline: GE Aerospace Stock Falls After Labor Deal. A Boeing Staff Dispute Is Ongoing.
summary: GE Aerospace settled a three week strike on Friday. Boeing employees in the St. Louis area are still asking for a new labor deal.

raw.headline: GE Aerospace Stock Falls After Labor Deal. A Boeing Staff Dispute Is Ongoing.

headline: GE Aerospace Successfully Completes Supersonic Flight Tests of a Solid-Fueled Ramjet at Kennedy Space Center
summary: GE Aerospace today announced the successful supersonic captive carry flight tests of its Atmospheric Test of Launched Airbreathing System (ATLAS) Flight Test Vehicle, marking a major milestone in advancing solid fuel ramjet (SFRJ) propulsion technology.

headline: RTX Secures a $670M Navy Contract for F135 Propulsion Spares
summary: RTX secures a $670.2M contract for F135 propulsion system spares, fueling F-35 support and boosting defense growth prospects.

headline: Will GE (GE) Labor Peace and Mexico Expansion Strengthen Its Competitive Edge in Aerospace Manufacturing?
summary: Earlier this week, GE Aerospace finalized a five-year labor agreement with over 600 striking United Auto Workers at its Ohio and Kentucky distribution facilities, ending a three-week strike, and announced a US$29.4 million investment in manufacturing operations in Hermosillo and Saltillo, Mexico focused on next-generation aircraft engine components. This combination of labor stability and expanded investment in engine production capacity highlights GE Aerospace’s efforts to support future...
